intro: Lalda communis, commonly known as the common lalda, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pale pink during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Lalda communis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
